power.title: Astral Eyes
power.fluff: Your eyes exude the light that bathes the Astral Sea, sharpening your sight and allowing you to perceive subtle details with ease

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Until the end of your next turn, you gain darkvision and a +2 power bonus to Insight checks and Perception checks.

section.name: Sustain Minor:
section.text: The effect persists until the end of your next turn.

section.name: Special:
section.text: As part of any rest, you can choose to expend a healing surge to enhance this effect.
If you do, the power is expended until you finish a long rest and you gain darkvision until you regain this power. You can also use the following action at-will:

section.name: Minor Action:
section.text: Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +2 power bonus to Insight checks and Perception checks.

power.title: Caress of Darkness
power.fluff: You whisper to those who dwell in the darkness, affirming your undying love and loyalty, and in return receive a caress that brings the gift of stealth

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Until the end of the encounter, you gain the following benefits:
You are considered trained in Stealth. If you are already trained, you instead gain a +3 power bonus to Stealth checks.
While you are in darkness or dimly lit, you gain a +2 power bonus to saving throws.

section.name: Dark Pact:
section.text: If you have the Shadow Walk class feature, it activates after moving 2 squares instead of 3.

section.name: Special:
section.text: When you use this power, you can choose to expend one or more healing surges to enhance it:
If you expend one healing surge, the power lasts for 1 hour instead.
If you expend two healing surges, it lasts for 8 hours instead and the bonus to saving throws applies to your death saving throws even if you aren't in darkness or dimly lit.
If you expend three healing surges, it lasts for 24 hours instead and you gain the bonus to saving throws at all times.

power.title: Chaos Armor
power.fluff: Power flows around you, girding you against the elements and lashing your enemies

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Choose acid, cold, fire, lightning or thunder. This power gains the corresponding keyword.
Until the end of the encounter, you gain resist 5 to the chosen damage type.

section.name: Level 11:
section.text: Resist 10.

section.name: Level 21:
section.text: Resist 15:

section.name: Elemental Pact:
section.text: Increase the resist by +5.

In addition, whenever an enemy scores a critical hit against you or hits you with an attack during your own turn, choose one enemy within 5 squares of you. The chosen enemy takes damage of the chosen type equal to your Constitution modifier + your implement's enhancement bonus.

section.name: Level 11:
section.text: Equal to 4 + your Constitution modifier + your implement's enhancement bonus.

section.name: Level 21:
section.text: Equal to 8 + your Constitution modifier + your implement's enhancement bonus.

power.title: Dark One's Own Luck
power.fluff: Refusing the result that fate has decreed for you, you invoke the power of your patron in an attempt to rewrite what has been written

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You make an attack roll, skill check, ability check, or a saving throw and dislike the result

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You reroll the triggering roll or check, using the higher of the two results.

section.name: Special:
section.text: If the triggering roll or check still fails, you regain the use of this power when you take a short rest.

power.title: Fate's Frayed Thread
power.fluff: With one miss, the fates collude against your enemy, heralding its ultimate doom

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: An enemy within 10 squares of you misses you with an attack

section.name: Target:
section.text: The triggering enemy in the burst

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You place your Warlock's Curse on the target.
Also, until the end of your next turn, the target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls against you and grants combat advantage to you.

power.title: Fey Switch
power.fluff: You step through the veils of the Feywild to the place where an ally stands and return to the world in that spot, instantly whisking your ally back to the place you started from

section.name: Fey Step:
section.text: If you are an eladrin with the fey step racial power, using this power does not trigger reactive strikes.

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You and the target ally teleport, switching spaces.

If one target has a larger space than the other, the smaller target teleports into a position of your choice within the larger target's original space, and the larger target teleports into a position of your choice that fully covers the smaller target's original space.

power.title: Iron Aspect of Dispater
power.fluff: Your skin becomes as hard as iron, making you immovable against your foes' attacks and giving weight to your punches

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Until the end your next turn, you gain resist to all damage equal to one-half your level, and you can ignore forced movement.
In addition, you make unarmed attacks as if you were armed with a +1 magic club.

section.name: Level 11:
section.text: +2 magic club.

section.name: Level 16:
section.text: +3 magic club.

section.name: Level 21:
section.text: +4 magic club.

section.name: Level 26:
section.text: +5 magic club.

power.title: Lesser Planar Ally
power.fluff: The air around you ripples and becomes heavy as you call forth a spirit of the planes to serve you

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You conjure a Tiny spirit of a planar being in a square adjacent to you. The spirit is an invisible conjuration that lasts until it is dismissed as a free action or until it completes its task, which can take no longer than 1 hour.
You can command the spirit to attempt one of the following tasks:

part.part-name: Locate an Object or a Person

section.text: The spirit can locate a specific object or creature within 5 miles of you that you have seen or touched.
When it completes the task, the spirit returns to you and describes the direction, distance, and location of the object or creature.
The spirit can provide a rough description of an area up to 20 squares on a side, including obvious physical features.

The spirit cannot open doors or containers, or breach physical or magical barriers, so it cannot explore any area that a Tiny creature couldn't reach. It cannot notice anything that requires a Perception check with a DC higher 10 + one-third your level to detect.
When it completes the task, the spirit returns to you and telepathically provides a mental image of the area.

power.title: Life Siphon
power.fluff: It's not pretty or kind, but sometimes you need to draw power from an ally's pain

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: An ally within 10 squares of you takes damage

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You gain a +2 bonus to one attack roll of your choice before the end of your next turn. This increases to a +3 bonus if the ally was bloodied by the triggering damage.

section.name: Dark Pact:
section.text: You regain hit points equal to one-fourth your level + your Dexterity modifier, and this power gains the Healing keyword.

section.name: Infernal Pact:
section.text: You regain hit points equal to one-fourth your level + your Constitution modifier, and this power gains the Healing keyword.

power.title: Mercurial Form
power.fluff: Your form flows and shimmers, allowing you to slip through cracks, escape an enemy's claws, and evade even the most persistent hunter

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Until the end of the encounter, you gain the following benefits:
You cannot be marked.
You can automatically end all grabs on you as a free action on your turn.
You can squeeze through tight spaces as if your size was Tiny.
Your DM might grant you additional benefits based on the circumstances.

power.title: Mirror Darkly
power.fluff: Your shadowy double appears at a distance, letting you split your essence between two points on the battlefield

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You conjure a shade in an unoccupied square within the burst. The shade occupies the same size of space as you do, and lasts until the end of your next turn.
If the shade takes any damage, it is destroyed and the power ends.

section.name: Aftereffect:
section.text: You can teleport to the space formerly occupied by the shade.
The shade can flank an enemy with you, but not with your allies.
While the shade perists, you are insubstantial, and can use your own space or the shade's space as the origin of all your attacks. Also, you can use the following action:

section.name: Move Action:
section.text: You and the shade teleport, switching spaces.

power.title: Racing Fire of Ulban
power.fluff: You move with the swiftness of Ulban, whose burning glory sometimes flashes across the sky in a fiery strak of blue and white

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You move twice your speed.

section.name: Star Pact:
section.text: You can choose fly your speed instead. If you do not land at the end of this movement, you fall.

power.title: Red Leeches of Nihal
power.fluff: Wriggling scarlet worms writhe suddenly over your foe's wounds before dissolving just as quickly into odious vapor that transports the stolen energy to you

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: A creature within 5 squares of you regains hit points

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The triggering creature takes necrotic damage equal to one-half your level.
You regain hit points equal to the necrotic damage the target takes + your Charisma modifier.

power.title: Rending Fear of Khirad
power.fluff: A pale blue flame springs up from your brow as you incant the apocalypses over which Khirad has burned, thus frightening your foe into an admission

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You demand the target answer your questions.

If you share a language, your helpless target provides its answers to the best of its knowledge, without distortion. If you do not share a language, you can ask only simple questions that the target can answer 'yes' or 'no'.
As long as the target remains helpless, you can keep asking it questions, up to a total number of questions equal to 1 + your Intelligence modifier.

power.title: Sand Shape
power.fluff: You transform your body into sand, allowing you to resist attacks and pass through barriers

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You assume a sand form until the end of your next turn. While in this form, you gain the following effects:
You are insubstantial.
You can pass through any opening large enough to accommodate a single grain of sand.
You gain a +5 power bonus to Stealth checks to hide in sand, or a +2 power bonus to hide in other environments where sand might be present.
You cannot attack, pick up anything, or manipulate objects.
Your DM might determine other effects, dependind on circumstances.

section.name: Sustain Minor:
section.text: The effect persists until the end of your next turn.

power.title: Shadow Ride
power.fluff: Your body flows as liquid darkness, pooling around another creature like a second shadow

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You shift up to 2 squares, and can enter any enemy's space during this movement. You can end this movement in an enemy's space.
If you do so, you share the enemy's space. Whenever the enemy moves before the start of your next turn, you move with it. Your movement in this way does not trigger any abilities.
At the start of your next turn, you appear in an unoccupied space of your choice adjacent to the target.

power.title: Shadow Slip
power.fluff: They came for your blood, but were left with only shadow

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: An enemy misses you with an attack that only targets you

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You teleport a number of squares equal to one-half your Charisma modifier.

power.title: Shroud of Black Steel
power.fluff: You coat your skin in living steel, blackened and hard yet supple enough to move, making yourself slower but much tougher and more resilient

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You cover your skin in living steel until the end of the encounter.
While covered, you gain a +2 power bonus to AC and Fortitude, but take a -2 penalty to speed. You can also use the following action at-will:

section.name: Move Action:
section.text: Until the start of your next turn, you are immobilized and the power bonus granted by this power increases to +4.

section.name: Special:
section.text: You can end this effect as a minor action.

power.title: Spider Climb
power.fluff: You bestow on yourself the ability to cling to almost any surface and climb as easily as an insect

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Until the end of your next turn, you have a climb speed equal to your speed.

section.name: Sustain Minor:
section.text: The effect persists until the end of your next turn.

section.name: Special:
section.text: As part of any rest, you can choose to expend a healing surge to enhance this effect.
If you do, the power is expended until you finish a long rest and you gain a climb speed equal to one-half your speed until you regain this power. You can also use the following action at-will:

section.name: Minor Action:
section.text: Until the start of your next turn, the climb speed granted by this power equals your speed.

power.title: Unspeakable Bond
power.fluff: The injury you sustain vanishes only to reappear on a nearby ally, and with it comes a cold anger that makes your ally a more dangerous combatant

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You take damage

section.name: Target:
section.target: one willing ally in the burst

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The target takes the triggering damage instead of you, including any ongoing damage it might inflict. You still suffer any other effects.

After the triggering effect has been resolved, the target gains a +2 power bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls until the end of his or her next turn. The bonus to damage rolls increases to +5 against the source of the triggering damage.

power.title: Walk Through Darkness
power.fluff: As you move, your body becomes shadow, slipping through foes and barriers with equal ease

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You shift up to 10 squares. During this shift, you are phasing and insubstantial.
